Palazzo del Bo (commonly known as Il Bò) has been the historic seat of the University of Padua since 1493. It is still the seat of the rectorate and the School of Law, as well as the oldest anatomical theatre in the world.
The School of Engineering coordinates 34 Degree Courses (Bachelor\'s, Master\'s and single-cycle) and the teaching activities of over 14,000 students.
The Beato Pellegrino Complex was inaugurated on September 30, 2019 and it includes the most beautiful library of the University of Padua.

Piazza delle Erbe, once also called Piazza delle Biade or Piazza del Vino but also Piazza della Giustizia, is one of the many squares that characterize the historic center of Padua. For centuries, it was, together with Piazza della Frutta, the commercial center of the city.

Piazza dei Signori or Piazza della Signoria is one of the many squares that characterize the historic center of the city of Padua. For centuries it was the scene of civic celebrations, tournaments and a space for the city\'s representation compared to the larger Piazza delle Erbe and Piazza della Frutta which had greater commercial propensities.

Prato della Valle is the largest square in the city of Padua, with a surface area of ​​88,620 m². The current configuration dates back to the end of the 18th century and is characterized by a central elliptical island, called Isola Memmia, surrounded by a canal on whose banks there is a double ring of statues, with an external circumference of about 572 meters.
